dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Rick, did you know someone found the First Emperor of China?  25. O’ CONNELL You’re kidding? Who did that son- of-a-bitch Willoughby finally get to do the job?

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Our son. She angrily spins and thrusts the newspaper into his ches

TITLE SUPERIMPOSED ON SCREEN: SHANGHAI, CHINA. It doesn’t stop until it FINDS a bubble-gum-pink neon sig It’s flashing above a glitzy nightclub “IMHOTEP’S -- COCKTAILS AND DANCING. The GORGEOUS ASI BARMAIDS are body-painted like Anck-su-namun. JONATHAN ho court at the bar. He’s wearing a white dinner jacket and a BEAUTIFUL SOCIALITE on each arm.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: +.» So the entire oasis sank into the desert. I said that’s it, I’m done with Egypt. It’s off to the Orient to follow my true dream. And when that didn’t work out, I opened this nightclub. He raises his champagne flute in a toast.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: To Imhotep! (under his breath) May the bastard actually stay dead.  26. They’re about to clink when the whole place goes SILENT. Jonathan turns and sees a TRIO OF JAPANESE OFFICERS, lead MAJOR SUKI, striding towards a table of INTENSE CHINESE M The Major stares at the leader of the group, CHANG.

dialogues.speaker: CHANG
dialogues.text: You’re in the wrong bar, they don’t serve sake here.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR SUKI
dialogues.text: Show me your papers.

dialogues.speaker: CHANG
dialogues.text: I don’t take orders from Japanese. Suki’s hand edges for his weapon when Jonathan intervenes

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, this club has a strict no-senseless-violence policy.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR SUKT
dialogues.text: These men are suspected Chinese insurgents. How can you serve their kind?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I serve all kinds, including Japanese officers with no jurisdiction. He SNAPS his fingers, THREE GORGEOUS BARMAIDS step over.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Now please enjoy my hospitality. As they lead the Japanese away, Jonathan addresses Chang.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I think it’s time you found somewhere else for your little get-~ togethers, Chang. I’m a lover, not a fighter. As he turns back to the bar, Jonathan is slapped across t face. He stares in surprise at Evy.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: How long has Alex been in China?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Alex is in China?  27. She slaps him again. O’ CONNELL You may want to rethink your answer.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: My son makes the biggest discovery of the century and I have to read about it in a newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I tried reaching you in India. But I guess you were out gallivanting on elephants or whatever you do on a second honeymoon. How was it? 0’ CONNELL Crocodiles, slugs, secret temples, you know, the usual.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Maybe you two should go on a package tour next time.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Jonathan!

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (finally caving) Alex sent me a telegram six months ago. He told me he needed extra money for books and would I be a good uncle and wire it to him. The next thing I know he’s on my doorstep, said he had an opportunity of a lifetime. O’ CONNELL Which part of “world war” made you think that was a good idea?

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: We sent Alex to America so he wouldn’t be in harm’s way.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Don’t blame me, he’s your son, it’s not like you two have been role models for playing it safe. O’ CONNELL Where is he?  28. As Jonathan points upstairs and they head away, CAMERA FI Major Suki observing from a booth. OFF his face... INT. ALEX’S APARTMENT - NIGHT There’s a KNOCK at the door. Alex swings it open, reveali Lily. She steps in and is surprised to see a candlelit ta for two and a bottle of champagne in a bucket.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Do you always study with candlelight and champagne? Alex feigns nonchalance.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Oh that. It was a gift from the British Consulate, apparently my discovery has been a big morale boost to everybody back home. (picking up bottle) Come on, one drink between friends before we hit the books. Lily smiles her agreement. With macho confidence, Alex tr to open the bottle, but struggles with the cork, finally puts the bottle between his knees.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Need a hand?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’ve done this a thousand times. It’s all in the wrist. At that moment, the cork POPS and a geyser of champagne sprays over him, drenching his shirt. As he turns away, w see that Lily is clearly charmed by his awkwardness.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Give me a minute. Alex steps behind a screen, takes off his shirt and looks a replacement. Lily sneaks a peep at his reflection in a mirror and clearly likes what she sees. There’s a LOUD KN at the door. Alex calls out...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m busy, slip the telegrams under the door. Another LOUDER KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: You want me to get it? Alex pops his head around the side of the screen, holding lamp under his chin which casts spooky shadows.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It’s probably just a mummy.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Alex, that’s not funny.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (scary voice) -++ @ mummy! Mummy! Suddenly, the door bursts open and Evy stands on the threshold. He looks at her in wide-eyed shock.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Mummy ! Alex puts down the lamp as Rick joins her. Evy stares in horror while Rick smiles, amused by the situation. 0’ CONNELL Hey, kiddo, get lost on your way to Yale? Alex looks at Evy, who is seething.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Mum, you look upset.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: I passed upset two time zones ago.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I can explain.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: You’re half naked, consorting with a bar-girl. It’s pretty self- explanatory.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Lily’s not a bar-girl.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: We’ re colleagues.  30.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: We were about to exchange valuable research, 0’ CONNELL T bet you were.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: And that required candles, champagne and taking off your clothes? Flustered, Alex pulls on a shirt.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Alex, I’m going. You obviously have some catching up to do. Good night, Mr. and Mrs. 0’Connell.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Lily, wait. As she heads out, Alex turns to his parents, exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Way to go guys, thanks. OQ’ CONNELL Let me get this straight. You lie to us and we’re supposed to feel bad about ruining your date?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It wasn’t a -~ (catches himself) I didn’t tell you about the dig because I knew what you’d say. That you don’t want me running around a country on the brink of war. 0’ CONNELL Yeah, we're terrible parents holding you back like that.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You parked me at Yale because you still think I’m a child. 0’ CONNELL We parked you at Yale so you’d live to see your next birthday.  31.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: For your information I tried to enlist. (off their shock) But they wouldn’t take me. Said I was 4F. Bad eyes. Flat feet.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: I’m afraid you inherited my family’s genes. The Carnahans aren’t known for producing football stars. Just look at your Uncle Jon.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: When Six Willoughby called and said I could be of service to my country, I jumped. (to Evy, excited) Mum, he’s going to make me a full Bembridge Scholar. 0’ CONNELL That doesn’t matter. But Evy’s face suddenly glows with pride.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Full scholar? Alex, that’s fantastic. Just what we’ve always dreamed about.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Sir Willoughby is throwing me a party at the British Consulate tomorrow night. . O’ CONNELL Evy, we’re supposed to be mad. United front, remember?

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Alex, it’s terrible you lied... (can’t contain herself) ... but congratulations! Give me a hug. As they hug, Rick rolls his eyes. Evy finally breaks off.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Now, tell me more about this Lily. OFF Alex’s embarrassment...  32.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Rick, this might be a good time to give Alex his present. Alex regards his dad with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You got me a gift? Rick sheepishly nods, hands Alex a box. O’ CONNELL You know, in honor of your big discovery. Alex RATTLES it gleefully, looks at Evy.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I bet it’s that new set of archaeological trowels I’ve had my eye on.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN

dialogues.text: The Japanese have been cracking down on the Chinese resistance, O’ CONNELL What will happen to them?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Nobody knows, they just disappear.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Lily said they get packed into trains and sent off to work camps. A couple of her friends got picked up last week.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Please tell me you’re not dating a revolutionary.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Lily's a student and, for the hundredth time, we’re not dating. They see a JAPANESE SOLDIER club one of the resistance fighters and start beating him with a baton.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Dad, if you’d done anything more, the Japanese would have us killed. They practically run Shanghai. 0’ CONNELL What about the British? Do they just throw fancy parties and pretend nothing’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: They’ ve got their hands full with the Nazis. O’ CONNELL It’s wrong.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: War always is. (beat) Now cheer up, for Alex’s sake. As they head inside, Jonathan hands the VALET the keys.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I’ve memorized every inch of this beauty. One scratch and we’re going to have an international incident.  36.

It’s being guarded THREE BRITISH SOLDIERS and sits under the room’s glass do A MILITARY BAND plays and the EXPAT CROWD is served by ELEGANT CHINESE HOSTESSES. As Rick, Evy and Alex make the way through, Alex sees Jonathan ducking away.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Uncle Jon, where are you going? The mummy’s this way.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I’ve seen enough mummies to last a lifetime, but I never tire of a well-stocked bar. They step to the sarcophagus. Evy is captivated.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Get a good look. They’re shipping it off to England tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Tomorrow? But you haven’t even opened it yet. O’ CONNELL Does the phrase “rest in peace” mean anything to you two? Evy runs her hand over the sarcophagus, stops when she co across five Chinese characters.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: I don’t recognize the characters in this cartouche.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: They represent the five Chinese elements.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Of course; earth, fire, water, stone, metal.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: If you believe the legend, the Emperor could control them.  37.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Better hope he doesn’t rise again. O’ CONNELL Wait. Nobody’s rising again. We’ve been there, done that. Evy, step away from the mummy. Rick and Evy notice Alex is staring at something, they fo his gaze and see Lily. She looks radiant in a mandarin- collared silk dress, and an unusual flame-shaped silver _ pendant graces her neck. She crosses to Alex.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: The operative word is “gulp.” Evy steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Lily, we wanted to apologize for last night. Alex caught us a little off-guard.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: If it makes you feel any better, you're all he ever talks about, Mrs. O’Connell. Evy smiles while Rick rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: If I could borrow Alex for a moment, the Dean of the University would like to meet him. As Alex heads away with Lily.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: I don’t know, there’s something about her that bothers me. O’ CONNELL Maybe it’s the fact that your son is clearly in love with her.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: He said they’re just colleagues.  38. 0’ CONNELL Yeah, on a dig, all alone in the desert. Sound familiar?

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: We couldn’t stand each other. O’ CONNELL That’s because you were impossible.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: And you were incorrigible. Rick smiles. 0’ CONNELL I say we step outside and settle this. She flashes a sexy smile as Rick pulls her out onto...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... he takes her in his arms and they passionately kiss. When they finally break off, she looks into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Still incorrigible.

dialogues.speaker: WILLOUGHBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello, Evelyn. Flustered, they turn and find Sir Colin Willoughby.

dialogues.speaker: WILLOUGHBY
dialogues.text: Rick. 0’ CONNELL Colin.

dialogues.speaker: WILLOUGHBY
dialogues.text: Sir Colin now. 0’ CONNELL That's the beauty of being American -- I don’t have to call you by those silly titles. There’s clearly no love lost between these two. Evy attempts to make peace.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: I’m grateful you’ve taken Alex under your wing. I know your mentorship has been invaluable. O’ CONNELL Yeah, pulling him out of college behind our backs, putting him in danger. You’re a real stand up, Colin.

dialogues.speaker: WILLOUGHBY
dialogues.text: I suggest you teach your husband some Manners. Good night, Evelyn. Evy waits while Willoughby exits, then turns to Rick.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: You promised to behave! 0’ CONNELL That idiot’s the reason you’re not a Bembridge Scholar. You’re lucky I didn’t deck him. . A CHINESE HOSTESS, wearing a red-and-black uniform, steps holding a silver tray with a note. She bows to Evy, who takes the note and reads it. She looks at Rick.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: The Ambassador wants to see us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Evy follow the Hostess through the crowd. She le them into a hall just as the BRITISH CONSUL hushes the cr

dialogues.speaker: BRITISH CONSUL
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, if you will please proceed to the garden, the fireworks are about to begin. INT. AMBASSADOR’S OFFICE - BRITISH CONSULATE - NIGHT AMBASSADOR FENWICK, a no-nonsense Brit in his 50s, drops into a glass while Rick and Evy look on.

dialogues.speaker: AMBASSADOR FENWICK
dialogues.text: What the devil happened at the Taj Mahal? You had specific instructions not to engage Okumura.  40.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: I know that, Sir, but I assure you that what we discovered will be of vital interest to the Home Office. As the Ambassador takes a sip of scotch, his face stiffen

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Sir, if I may say, you’re looking a little peaky. A beat later, the Ambassador keels over, revealing a Chin THROWING STAR imbedded in his back. 0’ CONNELL This meeting’s definitely over! When they spin, they come face to face with Okumura. He's flanked by TWO HOSTESSES who have throwing stars poised i their hands. As Rick reaches for his gun, Okumura’s metal hand flies up and vice-grips his throat.

dialogues.speaker: OKUMURA
dialogues.text: Where is the Eye? O’ CONNELL I think you have me confused with a twenty-foot croc with a serious case of indigestion. Okumura forces Rick to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: WILLOUGHBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I suggest you give the man what he wants. Evy turns and finds Willoughby at the doorway holding a g on her. Rick removes the Eye from the heel of his boot an tosses it into Okumura’s waiting hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the last guest heads outside, THREE HOSTESSES lock the doors. They smile flirtatiously at the three Soldiers . guarding the chariot, then in a blur of hands expertly hu throwing stars at them. The Soldiers drop to the marble, dead, just as Okumura and Willoughby lead Rick and Evy in

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: (to Willoughby) How could you do this? You're a knight of the crown.  41.

dialogues.speaker: WILLOUGHBY
dialogues.text: Empires come and go, Evelyn, you should know that better than anybody. Britain is the past, Japan's the future. O’ CONNELL Stupid son of a bitch. How much yen did Okumura pay you?

dialogues.speaker: WILLOUGHBY
dialogues.text: Enough for me to suggest to the Home Office that you two should follow him to India. 0’ CONNELL You set us up.

dialogues.speaker: WILLOUGHBY
dialogues.text: Those silly titles come in handy sometimes. Suddenly, the chandelier goes out. Willoughby grins.

dialogues.speaker: WILLOUGHBY
dialogues.text: It’s show time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOOOOOM! A cascade of fireworks EXPLODES overhead. Alex heads through the crowd, spots Jonathan.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Any sign of Mum and Dad?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: You know them, they’re probably in some quiet’ corner snogging. Alex smiles, then sees Lily heading for the Rotunda. As h follows after her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evy stares at Willoughby in contempt. O’ CONNELL There’s a special place in hell for people who sell out their country.

dialogues.speaker: WILLOUGHBY
dialogues.text: I didn’t sell out, General Okumura financed Alex's dig. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: WILLOUGHBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who better to find a mummy than an O’Connell... (turning to Evy) ... and who better to raise one than you, Evelyn. Another firework blossoms. Rick and Evy stare in shock as Okumura holds up Zohora’s TERRA COTTA BOOK OF THE DEAD.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Impossible! There’s only one Book of the Dead.

dialogues.speaker: WILLOUGHBY
dialogues.text: Emperor Qin Shihuang had a terra cotta copy. I’ve been searching for it for years. Finally tracked it to a fishing village in Nepal.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: I implore you if the Emperor rises, he’1l...

dialogues.speaker: OKUMURA
dialogues.text: ... bring about death and destruction. That’s the point. Rick understands. O’ CONNELL He’s your doomsday weapon.

dialogues.speaker: OKUMURA
dialogues.text: Japan will win the war without a single casualty. 0’ CONNELL It’s a mummy, not a genie. Trust me, these guys only work for themselves. Okumura SLAMS Rick in the face. Willoughby steps to Evy w the Book of the Dead.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: I’1l never read it. Okumura shoves his gun against Rick’s head.

dialogues.speaker: OKUMURA
dialogues.text: If you don’t, your husband dies, then I kill your son.  43. O’ CONNELL You touch Alex and I swear to God... Okumura COCKS the gun. Evy and Rick exchange anguished glances. Finally, she succumbs.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Give me the Book.

dialogues.speaker: WILLOUGHBY
dialogues.text: You always were the sensible one, Evelyn. As Willoughby hands her the Book, Okumura steps to the sarcophagus. He taps the symbols in the cartouche like an ancient combination lock. The lid splits open with a DEAFENING CRACK. Evy and Rick watch in horror as the lid slowly slides away and Emperor Qin Shihuang’s terra cotta mummy rises in the purple glow of another firework. Evy cautiously opens the book. 0’ CONNELL Evy, don’t do it! Evy ignores his plea.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: God forgive me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex steps around the side of the building, but there’s n sign of Lily. Some petals drop in front of him, he looks and sees Lily climbing off a wisteria lattice and onto...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex climbs up, doesn’t see anyone. He steps across the gravel to the glass dome, stares down, and is shocked to Evy reading from the Book of the Dead. He shakes his head

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I can’t take them anywhere. As another firework mushrooms, he sees Lily shimmying dow chain and stepping onto the enormous crystal chandelier t dangles directly over the Emperor Mummy’s sarcophagus.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Lily?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN ON EVY as she reads from the terra cotta Book of Dead. The ancient Egyptian incantation echoes and firewor wash everything in eerie Technicolor. PUSH IN ON RICK as a fierce wind whips and the Emperor Mu is cocooned in CRACKLING tongues of white hot energy. PUSH IN ON OKUMURA AND WILLOUGHBY watching in awe as the spectacle reaches a crescendo, then subsides. Okumura and Willoughby step forward expectantly, but the Emperor does move. He looks glossy and wet like a newly molded statue.

dialogues.speaker: OKUMURA
dialogues.text: Why hasn’t the Emperor risen?

dialogues.speaker: WILLOUGHBY
dialogues.text: She must have misread the book!

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: (indignant) I most certainly did not! Willoughby jabs the wet clay with one of his fat fingers shakes his head in contempt.

dialogues.speaker: WILLOUGHBY
dialogues.text: There’s a reason I never let this woman into the Bembri-- With shocking suddenness, the. Emperor’s arm reaches up a grabs Willoughby’s face. Willoughby ROARS in agony as the Emperor Mummy sucks his life force. As the Emperor Mummy’ skin hardens, Willoughby turns to terra cotta. Finally, t Emperor Mummy releases his grip. Willoughby falls back an SHATTERS on the floor like a porcelain doll. Rick and Evy watch in horror as the Emperor Mummy lurches and gulps his first breath of air in 2,200 years. His hardened lids pop open and he stares at them with Willoughby’s watery blue eyes. Okumura turns to them.

dialogues.speaker: OKUMURA
dialogues.text: At least you can die knowing you've aided a great cause. As he raises his gun...  45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex watches alarmed. He gets an idea, whips out the slingshot and scoops up a stone. He carefully steps onto glass rotunda and takes aim at Okumura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily is crouched on the chandelier. She pulls out a drago hilted dagger. It looks exactly like the one the Emperor used to stab Zohora. She’s about to leap down when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Alex fires. The stone BULLETS through the glass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... misses Okumura by a mile, ricochets off the bronze chariot, PINGS against the chandelier, before SHATTERING nose of the Emperor Mummy clean off. As maggots writhe ou through the stub, Evy turns to Rick.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: He’s still breakable. But Rick is following Okumura’s gaze up to... O’ CONNELL Alex.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (shaking head) I’m beyond rusty. Bullets BLAST up through the dome. He looks down to see Okumura FIRING at him. Before he has time to run, the gla rotunda spiderwebs and Alex is sent tumbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Alex plummets in a shower of glass,

dialogues.speaker: ALL HELL BREAKS LOOSE
dialogues.text: Lily reaches out, catches his arm and swings him onto the chandelier. Hostess #3 whips a throwing star up at Alex. misses him by a whisker but nicks the chain holding the chandelier. Before Hostess #3 can get off another star, E smashes the Book of the Dead over her head, obliterating  46.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Stay away from my son! Rick slides across the floor, snaps Willoughby’s gun out his terra cotta fingers, and starts FIRING at the Emperor Mummy. The bullets drill right through his hard shell ina spray of desiccated bone and maggots. As Rick’s gun CLICK empty, Okumura steps to the Emperor Mummy’s side.

dialogues.speaker: OKUMURA
dialogues.text: (in ancient Chinese) You must come with me. Everything will be explained. Lily sees Hostesses #4 and #5 stalking Evy. As they launc their throwing stars, Lily somersaults off the chandelier dive-tackles Evy out of the way. The Hostesses stare in horror as they are impaled by each other’s stars. As the Emperor Mummy sees Lily, his eyes flash with stran recognition. Then he presses his palm against one of the bronze horses, causing bolts of energy to cloak the statu Rick watches amazed as

dialogues.speaker: THE STATUES ANGRILY COME TO LIFE
dialogues.text: They stomp their hooves and whip their metallic heads. Wh the light show subsides, the Emperor Mummy and Okumura cl onto the chariot. Rick is about to give chase when he hea a SNAP! He sees the chandelier has broken free with Alex still clinging to it. Rick rolls out of the way as it SMASHES down while Alex falls into the sarcophagus, knock himself out. Rick shakes his head. 0’ CONNELL That’s my boy. Lily dashes forward, rolls under the chariot and clutches undercarriage as it speeds towards the French doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan looks around, irritated.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Where the hell is everybody? He’s crossing back to the house when the chariot powers through the French doors in an EXPLOSION of wood and glas Jonathan dives free and stares at the Emperor Mummy, who’ holding the reins, as the chariot barrels past.  47.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Oh no. Not again. Terrified GUESTS scatter as the four bronze horses stampe across the perfectly manicured lawn. The chariot’s two-fo wheel spikes amputate the legs off a row of statues. Then Jonathan sees the chariot is headed for a row of parked c His Bentley is smack in the middle!

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Watch out for.... He winces as the horses SMASH right over it, their metall hooves trampling it to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: .«.. my beautiful, brand-new Bentley. A canvas-roof truck SKIDS to a stop next to him. Evy is behind the wheel. Rick leans out of the back. 0’ CONNELL Get in! We have to save Alex. Before he can protest, Rick yanks him into the truck. As takes off in pursuit, we see the words “DRAGON FIREWORKS SHANGHAI” painted on the truck’s back-flap.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHARIOT
dialogues.text: speeds down the drive. TWO GUARDS OPEN FIRE, then scrambl out of the way. The horses blast through the massive gate like an ancient battering ram. Lily desperately clings to the undercarriage as the gates SLAM to the ground in a sh of sparks and the chariot bursts out into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s like a demolition derby. The chariot destroys everything in its path. Rickshaws, bicycles and market stalls are SMASHED to smithereens. It plows through an op air restaurant, sending CUSTOMERS scrambling. EVY -- turns on her wipers as a deluge of chop suey and dumplings splatters across the windshield. RICK AND JONATHAN -- are jackhammered around in the back. Jonathan RANTS as Rick searches crates of fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: God! You two are like mummy magnets.  48. Rick hands him a fat-ass rocket. 0’ CONNELL Aim for the Emperor. We can still shatter him. Rick RIPS a section of the canvas away, giving him a view over the cab. He ignites the end of a firework and aims i at the chariot like a shoulder-held rocket launcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is coming around. He pokes his head out of the sarcophagus and sees a firework streaking towards him! He ducks back down as the projectile HISSES over him and sna past the Emperor Mummy and Okumura. The Emperor Mummy whi the horses to go faster as TWO MORE rockets follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan grabs the biggest firework. It’s a four-foot monster. He lights the fuse and heaves it onto his should

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Let slip the dogs of war! KABOOOOOOOOM! The concussive force sends Jonathan flying back. The rocket SCREAMS down the street, misses the chariot, and impacts with a parked car, causing it to EXPLODE. The flaming vehicle is launched 10 feet into the air and flips as it crashes into the road right in front

dialogues.speaker: THE FIREWORKS TRUCK
dialogues.text: Evy frantically jerks the wheel and violently lurches the truck up a sloping side street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex peeps up over the lid, sees the Emperor Mummy and Okumura. He’s about to make a move when he’s tackled back into the sarcophagus by Lily. Alex stares at her in shock

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: What are you doing? First you’re climbing down chandeliers, now you’re jumping onto chariots. Are you trying to get yourself killed?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I was trying to rescue you.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: (flattered surprise) Really? As the chariot speeds over a pothole, they are thrown int each other’s arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick pops his head out and stares down over the rooftops is surprised to see they’ve pulled ahead of the chariot that’s charging down the street below. As the truck sweep past a house that’s under construction, Rick gets an idea 0’ CONNELL Stop the truck! Evy hits the brakes, sending Jonathan flying onto his ass ‘again. Rick dives off and grabs a bicycle that’s leaning against a wall. He shouts back to Evy. OQ’ CONNELL Keep going! Jonathan climbs into the front as she takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick leaps onto the bike, pedals furiously towards the construction site, rides up a wooden plank and onto the r Now, he careens down the tiled rooftops, flies right over alley, traverses a courtyard. Finally, he powers down a long, sloping roof. He uses it like a half-pipe, launches himself up over the street just as

dialogues.speaker: THE CHARIOT
dialogues.text: passes. Alex and Lily disentangle themselves, stare up fr the sarcophagus as Rick sails through the air.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Was that your dad?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Yeah, he’s got a hero complex. It’s kind of embarrassing. Rick SMASH-LANDS onto one of the front horses, lets go of bike, which is MANGLED under the CLATTERING hooves. He pu his gun as he swings up onto the beast’s back and FIRES a the Emperor Mummy, BLASTING off one of his ears.  50. OKUMURA OPENS FIRE. Rick ducks as BULLETS ricochet off th metal steeds. But then one hits the harness strap and sev it in two! No longer constrained, the horse gallops free. Rick bounces, in nut-numbing agony, as the horse heads fo ornamental moon door that’s way too small! O’ CONNELL Whoa! Rick ducks as the horse SMASH-DRIVES through and out into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A parade is in full swing. A 60-MAN ceremonial dragon is weaving its way down the packed street. DRUMMERS pound an strings of red firecrackers BANG! Rick’s horse “dissects” the dragon in three, plows through the drummers, then lea over the heads of the COWERING CROWD and into an alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chariot is hurtling when the fireworks truck SKID-TUR around a corner. Jonathan leans out, gun BLAZING. Okumura RETURNS FIRE. One of his rounds SHATTERS the truck’s windshield and RIPS through the partition and into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullet ignites a CRATE OF FIRECRACKERS, setting off a chain reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily peeks out, then looks back at Alex as she climbs out

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Stay down.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Lily, I have a lot more experience with mumm-- She cuts him off with a kiss. He looks at her in shock.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Just wait here, okay? As he tries to follow, his elbow inadvertently hits a but which causes the lid of the sarcophagus to start to close Alex reaches up and wrestles with the jade slab.  51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unaware of Alex’s trouble, Lily stalks up to the front of chariot. She pulls out her dragon dagger, but light glint off its blade, alerting Okumura. As he spins to face her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++. @ roman candle side-winds into the window. As Jonatha tries to snuff it out, Evy watches through the smoke as Okumura SHOOTS Lily point blank.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex has just about pried the lid open when Lily tumbles top of him and the lid SLAMS shut with awful finality. EXT. ALLEY ~— SHANGHAI - NIGHT Lines of wet laundry whip Rick’s face as the horse careen down the cobbles. He desperately pulls on the reins, tryi to get it under control. He yanks a pair of bloomers off face and sees he’s headed straight for a -- DEAD END!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIZZING rockets are now bursting through the fireworks truck’s canvas canopy as it speeds after the chariot. Suddenly, the wall in front of them EXPLODES OPEN and

dialogues.speaker: RICK AND THE HORSE
dialogues.text: burst into view. Rick looks back at Evy and Jonathan, can believe he made it. They point, only when Rick swings bac does he see that the horse’s head has been ripped clean o As more BULLETS fly, Rick grabs the reins. Without its he it actually seems to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch black. Alex flicks on a lighter, revealing Lily. She’s miraculously unharmed.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Any idea how to get out of here?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: These things usually don’t have ‘directions on the inside.  52. As the chariot makes a wild turn, Alex is knocked onto hi side and his lighter illuminates a saucer-size gold disc inlaid into the lid of the sarcophagus. It’s engraved wit five suns and five moons and is ringed by an inscription.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Maybe the lock’s under here. He attempts to pry the disc out with is fingers, but can’

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Try this. Alex reacts as she hands him the dragon dagger.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Cool knife. As he levers the disc free...

dialogues.speaker: EXT, WOODEN WHARF
dialogues.text: It stretches out into the Huangpu River. The chariot chur across the planks and barrels straight off the end! As it arcs toward the water, the Emperor Mummy holds out his ha Concentric circles of blue-white energy ripple out from h palm and form a 100-yard-wide frozen path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evy and Jonathan watch as the chariot SLAMS onto the ice.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Bloody hell, how did he do that?

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: He can control the five elements. As she spins the wheel and follows Rick onto... EXT. WOODEN WHARF -— NIGHT Rick hugs the broken neck of his horse as it speeds after chariot. He closes his eyes as the steed leaps off the wh and flies towards the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bronze horse SMACK-SLIDES down. It gallops after the chariot as the fireworks truck SCREECHES to a stop at the of the wharf.  53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chariot speeds towaxds Okumura’s junk, which is sitti in the middle of the frozen river. Rick has almost pulled alongside, he takes aim and BLASTS the bolt attaching the sarcophagus carriage to the chariot. As the sarcophagus carriage spins across the ice, the Emp Mummy swerves into Rick’s path. The chariot’s foot-long wheel-spikes SPARK-SLICE through the horse’s metal legs. the horse buckles over onto the ice and shatters apart, R is violently catapulted free. The chariot pulls up next to the junk, Okumura climbs onboard followed by the Emperor Mummy, who waves his hand across the river, causing the ice to melt. As the ice mel from under it, the carriage plunges into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sarcophagus slides free of the carriage and nose-dive through the moonlit water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water shoots through the cracks. It’s filling up fast. Alex looks into Lily’s eyes, it’s now or never.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Lily, there’s something I want to tell you before we die... As the water overwhelms them, he manages to blurt out...

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: «+. I’m in love with you. Before she can respond, the space fills with water. Suddenly, the sound of HAMMERING echoes.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Rick is bashing the lid with a foot-long length of a brok bronze horse hoof. The lid finally cracks apart and he stares into Alex and Lily’s grateful faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The junk sails into the mist as Evy and Jonathan look out into the dark water, distraught.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Rick... Alex...  54. As if in answer, Rick, Alex and Lily break the surface an climb onto the dock. Evy races to Alex, fusses over him.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Mum, I’m alright.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Thanks to Mr. O’Connell. O’ CONNELL Years of practice pulling Alex's fanny out of the fire. Rick doesn’t see, but we do, that Alex is stung by his qu Meanwhile, Evy looks at Lily, unsure.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: I’d say you can handle yourself, too. Those were some impressive moves back at the Consulate.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: My mother taught me self-defense. As Alex and Lily walk down the dock, Evy stares after the O’ CONNELL Evy, you’ve got that look, what’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: I could have sworn I saw Okumura shoot Lily. O’ CONNELL Must have missed. They hear a WOLF-WHISTLE, turn and see Jonathan standing the smoking fireworks truck.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Come on, undead on the loose. Chop. Chop. As Rick and Evy climb in, Alex pulls Lily aside.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Look, about what I said...

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: It’s okay, Alex, you were staring death in the face,  55. As she gets in, Alex shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Why couldn’t I have just drowned? As he climbs into a truck next to Lily...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its three triangular sails SNAP as the vessel silently sw past mist-draped mountains. Okumura stands at the bow, studying a map, while his CREW hustles around him.

dialogues.speaker: INT, CABIN
dialogues.text: The Emperor Mummy studies his wounds in a mirror. Fat maggots feast on his fossilized guts which poke out of hi bullet-riddled torso. There’s A KNOCK. Without turning he looks up. Through the bullet hole under his left eye, a M can be seen at the door behind him holding a tray of food As the Emperor spins to face him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blood-curdling SCREAM rings out. The CREW of JAPANESE SAILORS instantly stops and fearfully looks at Okumura, w is studying a map with a TIBETAN MONK.

dialogues.speaker: OKUMURA
dialogues.text: Keep working!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Emperor Mummy holds the SCREAMING Man by the face. Daggers of light cut through the Man and heal the Emperor Mummy’s wounds. As the Emperor Mummy drops the Man’s corp which smashes onto the floor, Okumura is revealed.

dialogues.speaker: EMPEROR MUMMY
dialogues.text: Why did you raise me from my slumber? The curse still weighs on me.

dialogues.speaker: OKUMURA
dialogues.text: Your condition is temporary. The Emperor Mummy looks at Okumura with piercing contempt Without warning, the Emperor Mummy grabs Okumura’s mechan arm. As he thrusts it to Okumura’s throat, the metal appendage morphs into a razor-sharp scimitar blade.  56.

dialogues.speaker: EMPEROR MUMMY
dialogues.text: The last general I trusted betrayed me. How do I know you won’t do the same? The blade presses into Okumura’s flesh.

dialogues.speaker: OKUMURA
dialogues.text: Because I have found the answer you spent a lifetime seeking -- the key to eternal life. The Emperor Mummy lets Okumura go, taken by surprise. Okumura hands him the Eye. The Emperor Mummy gazes into t Massive gemstone, awestruck.

dialogues.speaker: OKUMURA
dialogues.text: Once the curse has been lifted and you are immortal, there will be no battle you can’t win, no country you can’t conquer.

dialogues.speaker: EMPEROR MUMMY
dialogues.text: Conquest requires an army.

dialogues.speaker: OKUMURA
dialogues.text: Have no fear, your warriors will be ready.

dialogues.speaker: EMPEROR MUMMY
dialogues.text: What do you hope to gain? Okumura steps to a large globe, spins it with his finger.

dialogues.speaker: OKUMURA
dialogues.text: To rule the world by your side. The Emperor Mummy studies the globe, intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: EMPEROR MUMMY
dialogues.text: The world is round?

dialogues.speaker: OKUMURA
dialogues.text: Yes, and much bigger than the last time you conquered it. The Emperor Mummy smiles malevolently.

dialogues.speaker: EMPEROR MUMMY
dialogues.text: When the dragon roars again, you shall receive your just reward.  57. INT. “IMHOTEP’S” ~ DAY CLOSE ON: THE GOLD DISC. It’s the one Alex pried off the sarcophagus. dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Because Shangri-La is her home. OFF Rick’s stunned reaction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waterfalls cascade as far as the eye can see. The party i escorted by four Yeti while the one carrying Alex leads t way. Rick steps to Lily’s side, looks at his son. . O’ CONNELL How’s he doing? Lily CLUCKS to the Yeti carrying Alex. It CLUCKS back.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: He’s weak but holding on. He was brave to do what he did. He must get that from you. Ricks smiles sadly. Lily gently strokes Alex’s face.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: If I had destroyed the Emperor, Alex would be okay.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Is that what you’ve been trying to do?  76. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I couldn’t be honest with you or Alex. But I was sworn to protect Shangri-La at all costs.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Why are you breaking that promise now? Lily looks at Alex, then at Evy, finally confesses.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Because I love your son. The Yeti holding Alex stops in front of a raging waterfal and gently places Alex in Rick’s arms.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: The Yeti are the guardians of Shangri-La, but they cannot enter the realm. (re: waterfall) Step through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their distorted silhouettes are visible through the rippl curtain of water. They emerge on the other side bone dry. Lily crosses to the beautiful lotus-shaped fountain that bubbles up in the middle of the cavern.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: The Spring of Eternal Life. Lily cups a handful of water and splashes it across Alex’ wound. They watch as Alex miraculously heals.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Mum... Dad. Evy looks at Lily.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Thank you. Alex GROANS as he sits up. Rick and Evy smile, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Where are we?  77. O’ CONNELL Your girlfriend’s place.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Dad, she’s not my girl-- Before he can finish, Lily kisses him, overjoyed by his recovery. As he blushes in delight, TWO ROBED MEN appear.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: First you must disarm, no weapons or worldly possessions are allowed in Shangri-La. Lily gestures to the golden cauldrons that are piled agai the walls. Some contain weapons while others overflow wit gold, diamonds and priceless jewels.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: This place makes Hamunaptra look like a piggy bank.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: No sticky fingers, Jonathan. Rick pulls out an inordinate number of guns and knives th are hidden on his body, realizes everyone is staring at h O’ CONNELL What? EXT. SHANGRI-LA -— DAY Now disarmed, the gang steps out and stares in wonder at valley below which is lined with terraces of paddy fields tropical orchards and silky waterfalls. A village of pago like houses sits on the banks of a glimmering lake.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Now this is more like it. AN OMINOUS GONG booms across the valley.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: My mother's ready for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN, in a distinctive embroidered silk robe, stands o balcony. Only when Lily enters does the Woman turn and we see it’s ZOHORA. She_hasn’t aged a day in over 2,000 year  78.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: My child. They warmly embrace. Lily hands her the dragon dagger.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: Has the Emperor been destroyed?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: There were a few complications. zZohora reacts as the O’Connells, Jonathan and Tequila en

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: You’ve got quite a place here, (as Evy elbows him) But I’m sure you already knew that.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Without their bravery, the Emperor would have discovered Shangri-La. ZOHORA. I understand, but I let you out into the world to prevent the Emperor’s return. You were not to involve mortals. 0’ CONNELL Believe it or not, some of us mortals have experience in the mummy department.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: I am well aware of your family’s exploits, Mr. O’Connell. Which is why I sent Lily when I learned your son was searching for the Emperor’s tomb. Guilty, Lily looks at Alex.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Alex, I wanted to tell you, but--

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: It’s easier to say you don’t date colleagues than admit you’re an immortal from Shangri-La. I understand. Lily smiles, relieved. Rick looks at Zohora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 0’ CONNELL The Emperor may be down, but he’s not out. He still has twelve hours to find this place.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: I’ve already dispatched a party of Yeti to retrieve the Eye. Without it, he cannot find the Spring and break the curse. 0’ CONNELL With all due respect to your furry friends, they’re no match for a mummy .

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: No one knows the Emperor better than I do, Mr. O’Connell. I’m the one who cursed him. (off their surprise) I found the Book of the Dead. As a reward, the Emperor stabbed me and murdered the only man I ever loved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zohora rides through the blinding snowstorm.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I escaped into the night and rode for days. Weak, she finally topples off her horse and lands in a powdery drift, still clutching the terra cotta Book of th Dead. A shadow falls across her face. She looks up and se the outline of a Yeti silhouetted against the moon.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Yeti found me as I lay dying.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: They sensed I was with child and brought me to the Spring. The Yeti gently lays Zohora next to the GURGLING Spring.  80.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I knew I wouldn’t survive the night, so I used the Book to enchant the Spring. Whoever drank from it would become immortal. Zohora WHISPERS an incantation from the Book, causing the Spring to bubble with light. As Zohora drinks, the CAMERA FOLLOWS a trail of water as it flows out and cascades int

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bleak ice landscape undergoes a magical transformatio Trees and vegetation sprout, maturing in seconds, melting snow which forms the sparkling lake,

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And so Shangri-La was born. It’s a Yeti word that means “valley of dreams”. I saw it as a utopia from a world that grew crueller by the day. Here we would be safe from the Emperor and tyrants like him. The frozen waterfalls that ring the valley begin to gush.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Over the centuries, the Yeti brought lost and dying travellers to the Spring. We see a motley collection of people step through the waterfall from every race and era: CRUSADER KNIGHTS, RENAISSANCE TRADERS, VICTORIAN EXPLORERS.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: All chose to stay and make this their home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new arrival, FU, wears his threadbare imperial robes. H tosses his purse into one of the golden cauldrons.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ++. except one. He was among our first inhabitants. An imperial eunuch named Fu. He expressed gratitude that I’d freed him from the Emperor’s tyranny, but secretly he wished to bring his master back.  81. INT. ZOHORA’S CHAMBER - NIGHT While Zohora sleeps, Fu climbs through the window and cro to the Book of the Dead which sits on her desk.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: So he stole the Book of the Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fu gallops along a narrow mountain path overlooking a riv when a Yeti leaps in front of him. As Fu tries to spin ba another Yeti nails him in the heart with the dragon dagge

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: The Yeti tracked him down, but the Book was lost to antiquity. Fu SCREAMS as his body rapidly ages. As his wizened corps falls from the saddle, the backpack with the Book tumbles over the cliff and drops into the river below.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The book slowly twists into the darkness. END FLASHBACK.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: I feared that someday it would be found and used to raise the Emperor. Now that day has come. O’ CONNELL Well, I’m not going to wait around here until he comes knocking. Zohora nods her understanding.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: If you insist on facing the Emperor, you’re going to need this. She hands him the dragon dagger.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: It’s the dagger he stabbed me with. I enchanted the blade. It’s the only weapon that can kill an immortal. But it must pierce his heart.  82. Rick nods his thanks, then turns to Evy. O’ CONNELL Come on, Evy. (to Alex) Alex, you stay here with Jonathan and Tequila. As Ricks steps to the door, Alex blocks his way.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Dad, I’m going with you. 0’ CONNELL You almost died out there. I won’t let that happen again.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I can take care of myself. You have to stop treating me like a child. 0’ CONNELL Sorry, I’m your dad. It’s an occupational hazard. OFF Alex’s frustration as Rick and Evy head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA SWEEPS UP PAST the remains of the Ladder of Heaven FINDS Okumura struggling up the sheer rock face with his metallic arm. He finally pulls himself over the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he lies PANTING, he sees FIVE YETI watching his predicament. As they step towards him holding spears, one them stops, sniffs the air, as though sensing danger. Wit shocking suddenness, two giant arms formed of snow reach of the ground, grab the creature by its legs, and

dialogues.speaker: YANK
dialogues.text: it straight down into the snow. In violent succession, th other Yeti are pulled under until they’ve vanished. The a morph into the Emperor’s dragon insignia. Okumura scrambl away as the insignia melts and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is revealed lying in the circular pit. His torso is craze with cracks and half his face has broken off, revealing h maggot-infested skull and brain. Still clutching the Eye, walks up the smooth-walled trench that magically melts be him. It leads straight to the top of the stupa. Okumura watches as the Emperor Mummy places the Eye into circular depression that’s hollowed out of the bronze fla that still graces the top of the stupa. As

dialogues.speaker: SUNLIGHT
dialogues.text: hits the Eye, the flame glows and a circle of emerald lig explodes out across the valley. Slowly, the band narrows until it’s a single line of light which pinpoints one of waterfalls on the far side of the valley. OFF the Emperor Mummy’s smile of satisfaction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Evy step out from behind the THUNDERING cascade are greeted by TWO YETI GUARDS. As one leads Rick and Evy the path snow begins to swirl. Rick looks up as the sun i smothered by black storm clouds. OFF this ominous portent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fireflies dance across the water. Lily stands in the gold moonlight with her back to Alex as he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’d give a penny for your thoughts, but you don’t allow money in here. When she doesn’t turn, he comes around and sees tears shimmering down her face.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Alex, this isn’t going to work between us.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Look, if it’s the age difference? Because I have no problem dating an older woman. She puts a finger to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: You have to understand I’m going to live forever. 1/11 be here until earth’s dying light.  84.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Then I’11 drink from the Spring, too. We can watch the end of the world together.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: If you did that, you could never leave Shangri-La. I know you, Alex, you couldn’t spend eternity stuck on the sidelines.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Come back to Shanghai, it’s not paradise, but at least we’1l have each other.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I can’t leave here again and I can’t ask you to stay. Distraught, she walks away. Alex calls after her.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Lily, wait! There must be a way. Lily looks back, her heart breaking.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Alex. As she heads off, teary eyed, CAMERA FINDS Zohora watchin OFF her look of maternal resignation... INT. LILY’S CHAMBER - NIGHT Zohora enters and finds Lily lying on her bed. Zohora gently sits on the edge of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: I knew that once I let you into the world that you wouldn’t want to return. You have your father’s restless spirit. Lily wipes her tears as she slowly turns to face her.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Out there I felt emotions I never had. Fear, exhilaration...

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: «+. love?  85. Lily nods.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: Do you want to spend the rest of your life with Alex?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I'd like the chance to find out.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: Are you prepared to sacrifice your immortality?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: If only that were possible.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: It is. Lily stares in surprise as Zohora holds up a small blown- glass bottle containing an aqua-blue liquid.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: Once you drink this, you can never return to Shangri-La.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Mother, why are you doing this? Zohora looks into her daughter’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: Because after 2,000 years, I think it’s time you chose your own destiny. OFF this emotional moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow is coming down thick and fast. A bitter wind WAILS. Rick and Evy struggle through the blizzard when the Yeti walking in front of them is suddenly yanked into the snow Rick spins back, catches a glimpse of the Emperor Mummy a Okumura. As he races towards them, “snow arms” burst up a wrap around his legs. As he is dragged down, Rick grabs t

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON DAGGER
dialogues.text: and slices through the arm that’s pulling him under in a spray of hot steam and white light. As another “snow arm” twists up, Rick cuts it in two and dives for Evy. He grab her arm a second before she is yanked under.  86. It’s a desperate tug-0’-war but finally, he pulls her tor free and hacks the arm that’s holding her. As the amputat “limb” thrashes like a beheaded snake, Rick and Evy take after the Emperor Mummy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonlight filters through the curtain of water as the silhouettes of Okumura and the Emperor Mummy appear. They step through and the Emperor Mummy stares at the Spring.

dialogues.speaker: OKUMURA
dialogues.text: Your search is finally over, my Lord. The Emperor slowly turns to face him, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EMPEROR MUMMY
dialogues.text: Kneel and swear allegiance to me.

dialogues.speaker: OKUMURA
dialogues.text: (confused) But we had an agreement. I am to rule by your side. The Emperor Mummy pokes his finger into Okumura’s forehea His skin smokes like it’s been seared by a cigarette ligh

dialogues.speaker: EMPEROR MUMMY
dialogues.text: There is only one emperor. In agony, Okumura falls to his knees and bows.

dialogues.speaker: OKUMURA
dialogues.text: I serve only you. The Emperor Mummy removes his finger, steps into the Spri of Eternal Life and hungrily gulps the water. As the wate courses over his body, it sparkles with energy. A new bra forms in his broken head, a new eyeball sprouts and skin grafts across his cracked torso. He ROARS in triumph...

dialogues.speaker: EMPEROR MUMMY
dialogues.text: The world is mine. As he fills a silver flask with Spring water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan and Tequila are wrapped in towels, lying side by side, getting massages from a QUARTET OF STUNNING GIRLS.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Now this is what I call paradise.  87. Suddenly, the shutters blow open and their breath fogs.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Is it me or did it just get chilly? They peer out the window and see a wave of ice sheeting o across the valley from the mouth of the cavern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrified RESIDENTS run in panic as Jonathan and Tequila burst out, half naked. They struggle to put on their clot as they race over to Alex.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: The Emperor’s here.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Where are your parents when we need them? (realizing) Oh God, I hope nothing’s happened--

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: You can’t think that way, Uncle Jon. Zohora and Lily run up.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: You must leave Shangri-La. Lily will show you the way.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: I’m not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Alex, if you try and fight the Emperor here, you'll lose.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: The Emperor will return to his palace and use the Spring water to raise his army. You must unlock the River of Spirits before his warriors reach the Great Wall.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: River of Spirits?

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: That’s the only way to stop them. Lily will explain.  88. The ice sweeps across the lake towards the village.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: Now go! The fate of the world depends on you. As they race away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Total chaos. People SCREAM as ice washes down the street, freezing everything in its path. As Zohora spins back, sh sees the Emperor Mummy. His eyes flash with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: EMPEROR MUMMY
dialogues.text: Zohora, I thought your bones would be dust by now... but you’re as beautiful as the day you betrayed me.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: My only regret is that I didn’t kill you when I had the chance.

dialogues.speaker: EMPEROR MUMMY
dialogues.text: Then I would never have met your daughter. She possesses your beauty and her father’s courage. She will make an even better queen than you. Zohora reacts in desperation.

dialogues.speaker: ZOHORA
dialogues.text: Your fight is with me. Spare Lily and my people. I beg you. The Emperor Mummy smiles menacingly as he steps closer.

dialogues.speaker: EMPEROR MUMMY
dialogues.text: They shall feel the full wrath of your curse. Her terrified subjects watch as the Emperor Mummy grabs Zohora and kisses her. He stands back and watches as the terra cotta curse washes over Zohora and her people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Evy race through the blinding snow and arrive at entrance to Shangri-La, but find the Yeti Guard dead and waterfall frozen solid,  89.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: We’ re too late! Evy pounds on the solid ice curtain, grief stricken.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Alex!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and the gang run with a THRONG through the trees. Suddenly, the crowd suffers the same fate as the warriors the opening and turn to terra cotta. As the path opens on a waterfall, Jonathan stops, untouched by the curse.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Why didn’t we turn into lawn ornaments?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: The curse must only affect immortals. They all turn to Lily. She holds up the glass vial Zohora gave her. It’s now empty. Alex realizes her sacrifice.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Oh God, Lily, I never meant for you to--

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: It’s okay, Alex. It was my choice to make. The moment is broken by the sound of ice CRACKLING throug the jungle. They scramble through the waterfall and into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily points to a tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Follow the trail, it’11 lead you out through the mountain. She steps back to the waterfall.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I won’t let my mother face the Emperor alone. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: LILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (kissing him) I love you. She dives back through the waterfall just before it freez

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Lily, no! Alex races forward, POUNDS the ice wall, but it’s futile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily runs past the petrified citizens until she sees the Emperor Mummy standing in front of Zohora’s terra cotta f

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Mother! She lunges at the Emperor Mummy. But Okumura intercepts h and forces Lily to her knees.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I'll never bow to you.

dialogues.speaker: EMPEROR MUMMY
dialogues.text: I don’t expect you to bow. I expect you to share my bed and pay for your mother’s sins. OFF her look of defiance... EXT. MOUNTAIN — DAY Sunlight bleeds across Alex, Jonathan and Tequila as they trudge over the harsh, windswept snowscape.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Exactly how far is the Emperor’s palace?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: About a thousand miles.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Perfect, so if we don’t die of frost bite, we should be there sometime next year. A BUZZING SOUND ECHOES.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Hopefully, that’s a herd of Yeti to the rescue.  91. As the sound GROWS LOUDER, Alex shouts...

dialogues.speaker: GET DOWN
dialogues.text: All dive as two silver cargo planes ROAR overhead. EXT, FROZEN LAKE ~— DAY The Emperor Mummy and Okumura wait with Lily as the plane touch down on the ice.

dialogues.speaker: EMPEROR MUMMY
dialogues.text: Machines that can fly. I often dreamt of such a thing. As the Emperor Mummy, Lily and Okumura head for one of th planes, they pass 10 wooden mule carts piled with the treasure-filled cauldrons from Shangri-La. As SIX JAPANES SOLDIERS begin loading the cauldrons into the other plane

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, Jonathan and Tequila cautiously creep up to the edg and peer down into the valley. Alex catches sight of Lily she disappears up the gangplank of the plane.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Lily! He’s about to charge after her when a hand pulls him back Alex spins in surprise and is overjoyed to find

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Mum! Dad! Thank God. All embrace. Rick looks down at Lily’s plane as it begins taxi across the lake, then turns back to Alex. O’ CONNELL We'll get her back, son. I promise. OFF Alex’s distress as the plane lifts off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Japanese Soldiers have paired up and are struggling t carry the last three cauldrons into the plane.  92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Soldiers put the cauldrons down. They’re catching the breath when Rick erupts out of a cauldron in an explosion coins and fists. He punches out two of the Soldiers and grabs their guns as they crumble. Then Evy and Alex burst and punch out another two Soldiers. However, the last two Soldiers swing up their weapons. A tense stand-off. Of CONNELL Now would be a good time, Jonathan. Jonathan pops out of a cauldron behind the Soldiers, brandishing a jewelled scepter, and takes them both out.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: The old Ali Baba trick, works every time. : O’ CONNELL Where the hell were you?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (re: scepter) Sorry, got a little distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PILOT is checking the gauges when the nose of a machi gun digs into his neck. PULL BACK TO REVEAL RICK. O’ CONNELL Change of flight plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the plane soars into the cloudless sky, REVEAL the six Japanese Soldiers shivering in the snow in their underwea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonlight flashes off the plane’s metallic body as its propellers CHURN through the clouds at 20,000 feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tequila is drinking sake while Jonathan is conferring wit the Pilot in pigeon Japanese. Rick enters.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: My Japanese is a little rough, but he says we’re not far from the Emperor’s palace.  93. O’ CONNELL Don’t take your eyes off him. Jonathan awkwardly holds up his gun.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: He’s going to feel my gaze boring into the back of his head. Rick steps back into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Evy and Alex are waiting.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: Zohora said we had to unlock the River of Spirits. It’s the only way to stop the warriors. O’ CONNELL Chinese history is your forte, kiddo. Any idea what she was talking about?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: The Emperor threw the bodies of his enemies in a river that stretched thousands of miles across China. Legend has it that he slaughtered so many people, the river ran dry. Evy’s mind whirs as she puts it together.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: The water may be gone, but the spirits of the dead still flow through it. Where is this river?

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: There. Alex points out the window as the plane banks revealing t Great Wall in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: The Emperor built the Great Wall over it.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: So the Wall’s really a giant tomb. Alex nods.  94.

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
dialogues.text: The Emperor must have feared that the vanquished spirits would come back and seek revenge. He built the Wall to keep them in. 0’ CONNELL Great, all we’ve got to do is unlock this ghost river before the mummy and his terra-cotta army take over the world.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: Thankfully nobody’s spent more time in tombs than the three of us. Or at least, anyone with a pulse. An EXPLOSION booms up from the ground. They all rush into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick grabs binoculars and looks out the window. WHAT HE SEES: A fireball consuming a railroad bridge that _ traverses a wide desert chasm. As the bridge collapses. The Pilot uses the distraction to surreptitiously reach u his seat and unsheathe a razor-sharp dagger. 0’ CONNELL Looks like a railroad bridge. Guess they don’t want anyone gatecrashing the palace. The plane tilts.

dialogues.speaker: EVELYN
dialogues.text: We’ re veering off course.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: (to Pilot) Hey, no funny business. When he nudges him with the gun, the Pilot slumps back, revealing the dagger protruding from his chest.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Bloody hell, he’s stabbed himself!

dialogues.speaker: ALEX
